thread.title: Duke expands deal to play baseball at Bulls' ballpark
thread.title_full: Duke expands deal to play baseball at Bulls' ballpark

author: Times-News
title: Duke expands deal to play baseball at Bulls' ballpark
text: Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 10:48 PM Updated at 10:49 PM Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 10:48 PM Updated at 10:49 PM DURHAM — The Duke baseball team renewed its agreement with the Durham Bulls to play an expanded schedule of home games at the Durham Bulls Athletic Park, home of the Class AAA affiliate of the Tampa Bay Rays. Beginning next season, the contract renewal is a seven-year agreement that allows Duke to play up to 36 exhibition and home games at the stadium each year. The agreement also calls for a limited number of Duke practices at the facility as well as a new permanent Duke locker room and clubhouse at the facility. Duke and the Durham Bulls began their partnership prior to the Blue Devils’ 2010 season. The 2016 campaign marks the seventh consecutive season in which Duke will play homes games at the stadium. Under the new agreement, the Blue Devils will play the vast majority of their home schedule at the minor-league venue. Duke plays other games on campus at Coombs Field. By Times-News
